[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Function: to_seconds()] [Critical Unimplemented Function] The to_seconds() function aborts with code 0 instead of converting milliseconds - if vault operations, epoch calculations, or time-locked withdrawals depend on this conversion, all time-based logic will fail causing operational DoS and potential fund lock. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Function: refund()] [Fund Loss via Abort] If the vault adaptors (Navi, Cetus, Suilend, Momentum) attempt to refund excess funds or failed operation assets using this function, the abort(0) will cause transaction failure with the coins still locked in the calling context, leading to permanent fund loss. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Function: to_seconds()] [Time Logic Failure] If vault locking windows, withdrawal delays, or epoch-based operations use to_seconds() for time calculations, the abort will cause all time-gated operations to fail, potentially preventing withdrawals indefinitely or breaking epoch rollover logic. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Module: utils] [Dependency Risk] This module is located in local_dependencies/mmt_v3, suggesting it's a third-party AMM dependency. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Function: refund()] [Generic Type Safety] The refund function accepts any Coin<X> type but provides no implementation - if called with vault share tokens, LST tokens, or protocol tokens, the abort could occur after state changes but before refund completion, leading to inconsistent state. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Function: refund()] [Access Control Missing] The refund() function is public with no capability requirements - any caller can attempt to trigger it with any coin and recipient address, though it will abort. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Function: to_seconds()] [Overflow/Precision Issues] When implemented, millisecond to second conversion (divide by 1000) could have precision loss for sub-second timing or overflow issues for very large millisecond values. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Module: utils] [Testing Gap] The presence of abort(0) stub implementations suggests this code is not production-ready. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Function: refund()] [Coin Destruction] If refund() is called with coins that should be returned to users, the abort will cause the transaction to revert, but the coin object may be destroyed or left in an inconsistent state depending on when in the transaction flow it's called. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Module: utils] [Compilation vs Runtime] While the code compiles successfully (abort is valid Sui Move), runtime behavior will fail all callers. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/utils.move] [Function: refund()] [Transaction Atomicity] If refund() is called as part of a multi-step transaction (e.g., operation completion, asset return, refund excess), the abort will cause the entire transaction to revert, potentially leaving operations in inconsistent states if not properly structured.
